thread.title: Giants DT gets extra preparation for Green Bay by playing ‘Madden’ as Aaron Rodgers
thread.title_full: Giants DT gets extra preparation for Green Bay by playing ‘Madden’ as Aaron Rodgers

author: Mark Sandritter
title: Giants DT gets extra preparation for Green Bay by playing ‘Madden’ as Aaron Rodgers
text:
New York Giants defensive tackle Damon Harrison will make his NFL playoff debut on Sunday against the Green Bay Packers . That doesn’t mean, however, he’s lacking playoff experience. He has plenty of that, thanks to playing Madden .
"I go to the playoffs every year on Madden so I have some playoff experience." pic.twitter.com/lwvSOKzqTK 
— Kenny Ducey (@KennyDucey) January 5, 2017 “I just won the Super Bowl last night on Madden ,” Harrison said. “I go to the playoffs every year on Madden so I have some playoff experience.”
Harrison also noted that “ Madden doesn’t lie” and that he’s been studying up on Aaron Rodgers and the Packers with the video game.
“If you make [Rodgers] go to his left, he’s not as accurate as when he goes to his right,” Harrison said, via Newsday . “Because the video game can’t compensate like he can in real life.”
If Harrison has a big game on Sunday, we’ll know why.
